snippet: The Russian bank has agreed to buy DenizBank, a Turkish subsidiary of the struggling French-Belgian lender Dexia, for $3.5 billion, as Sberbank looks to diversify away from its home market.
abstract: The Russian bank has agreed to buy DenizBank, a Turkish subsidiary of the struggling French-Belgian lender Dexia, for $3.5 billion, as Sberbank looks to diversify away from its home market.

headline.main: Sberbank of Russia to Buy DenizBank for $3.5 Billion
headline.print_headline: Russian State Bank Expands in Turkey With Deal to Buy DenizBank
